customer_reviews.title: The perfect paella pan
customer_reviews.text: I have two 18" Garcima pans but this is the one I really need when making paella for a group of six to eight people. I love it because it gives me plenty of room for lots of rice, shrimp, clams, sausage, etc. It also allows me to spread out the rice in a thin layer to achieve my soccarat. Once seasoned it's easy to clean and hang in my basement rafters for the next cookout.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!

product_meta.title: Garcima 20-Inch Carbon Steel Paella Pan, 50 cm, Large, Silver
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1Serves 6 to 10 people. This size usually fits over two standard burners. The pan is made of carbon steel (aka polished steel, or acero pulido), which is ideal for paella since it conducts heat quickly and evenly. The pan is thin but quite rigid and durable, with a hammered dimpled bottom. The handles are made of steel and painted red. Carbon steel is the traditional material for paella, and some paella devotees feel that it enhances flavor. As with any raw steel pan, it requires some care: you must dry the pan right after washing it and then rub the inside with a little vegetable oil to prevent rusting. If the pan does rust, a few passes with steel wool takes it right off.
feature_bullets: Authentic paella pan. Made in Spain.
Carbon steel is durable and conducts heat well. requires a bit of maintenance after washing.
Safe for stovetop, oven, or grill.
The pan comes with an informative pamphlet that contains two recipes, tips for perfect paella, and care instructions.
